description: Borrowed from Latin adiacēns, adiacentis, derivative of adiaceo (“I lie beside”); from ad (“to”) + iaceo (“I lie down”).

entries.meaning: Lying next to, close, or contiguous; neighboring; bordering on.
examples: Synonyms: abutting, adjoining, contiguous, juxtaposed, near
Because the conference room is filled, we will have our meeting in the adjacent room.
The picture is on the adjacent page.

entries.meaning: (figuratively, postpositive) Related to; suggestive of; bordering on.
Something that lies next to something else, especially the side of a right triangle that is neither the hypotenuse nor the opposite.
examples: Picking out the opposite, the adjacent, and the hypotenuse […]
The house adjacent to the school was demolished.
A notice was sent to the house adjacent the school.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Related to; suggestive of; bordering on.
